column1: San Antonio de los Baños is a municipality and town in the Artemisa Province of Cuba. It is located 26 km from the city of Havana
column2: and the Ariguanabo River runs through it. It was founded in 1802.

column1: There are 39 schools in the town
column2: employing over 600 teachers. These schools include an academy of plastic arts
column3: a school for training art teachers
column4: and the International School of Cinema and Television Escuela Internacional de Cine y Televisión which was established in 1986. The town's library was founded in 1975
column5: and has a collection of more than 32
column6: 000 books. There is also the San Antonio de los Baños Municipal Museum.

column1: San Antonio de los Baños Airfield
column2: was inaugurated on September of 1942. Initially operated by transport aircraft and bombers Douglas B-26 and Boeing B-29
column3: which conducted training in the Caribbean
column4: no aircraft that was part of Cuban aviation could land at the Military Base without prior authorization from the same authorities .

column1: The municipality is divided into the barrios of Este Urbano
column2: Centro urbano and Oeste urbano as well as La Ceiba
the municipality of San Antonio de los Baños had a population of 46
column3: 300. With a total area of 127 km2 (49 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 364.6/km2 (944/sq mi).
